column1:
Odeinoichus,"2017-05-20T18:10:07.227Z","Disney Princess' come to Life.","

Set # 30116 Rapunzel’s Market Visit: This is a nice little Disney Princess Polybag and features a nice mini-doll. We’ll discuss the pros and cons and then my recommendation.
Pros:

column2: Market Stall Mini-Model uses fun simple build and great colours (teal and pink) and includes some nice pink flowers and a croissant piece as stuff being sold. Though it is odd to see them selling baking and flowers at the same place.

Rapunzel Mini-Doll is beautiful. I love the look of her dress and the printing just captures the look of the character quite nicely. She also gets three bows to put in her hair to mimic the braiding from that scene during the movie.
Some nice unique pieces here there’s a few teal sloped parts and a blue mini-figure basket backpack kind of thing.

column1: Cons:

column2: Missing Pascal, I think it would have been nice to include one of the animals from the film in this set.
Piece count is rather low, typical for polybags, however I feel it could use a bit more. Perhaps just an extra piece for the stall to keep it level when it’s stationary at the market.

Rapunzel’s dress has ‘Princess’ printing at the bottom of her legs. She isn’t actually dressed as a princess yet during the movie so the sparkly design (which is the same as Cinderella’s) looks a bit off.

column1: Overall opinion

Overall I’d recommend this set if you can find it still. It’s a great way to get the Rapunzel mini-doll without having to pay for the larger set. However I’d still recommend the Creativity Tower just a little bit above this one if you’re a fan of the character. It’s nice for the parts though.
